title: Pasturage

thumbnail.alt_text: Painting of brown and white cows in green pasture, trees and building in background.

publication_history:
Eddy, Arthur Jerome, Cubists and Post-Impressionism (Chicago: A. C. McClurg, 1914), pp. opp 182 (ill.), 200, as Pasturage. 

Art Institute, The Arthur Jerome Eddy Collection of Modern Paintings and Sculpture, exh. cat. (Chicago: Art Institute, 1931), pp. 22 (cat. 14), 25 (ill.), as The Pasture, c. 1912. 

Rhode Island School of Design, Exhibition of Paintings, Water Colors, Drawings and Prints by A. Dunoyer de Segonzac, exh. cat. (Providence: Rhode Island School of Design, 1933), n.p. (cat. 1), as Pasturage.

Cincinnati Art Museum, Pictures for Peace, A Retrospective Exhibition Organized from the Armory Show of 1913, exh. cat. (Cincinnati: Art Museum, 1944), n.p. (cat. 30), as The Pasture. 

Amherst College, The 1913 Armory Show in Retrospect, exh. cat. (Amherst, Mass.: Amherst College, 1958), pp. 17 (cat. 14), 18, as Pasture, c. 1912. 

Art Institute, Paintings in the Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Chicago: Art Institute, 1961), p. 133, as Pasture, 1912. 

Flint Institute of Arts, Masterpieces in the Midwest, exh. cat. (Flint: Institute of Arts, 1961), n.p. (cat. 43), as Pasture. 

Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, Armory Show – 50th Anniversary Exhibition, exh. cat. (Utica, N. Y.: Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, 1963), pp. 50 (cat. 247, ill.), 204, 211, as Pasture (Sène de paturage), 1912.

Speyer, A. James and Courtney Graham Donnell, Twentieth-Century European Paintings (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1980), pp. 41–42 (no. 1G1), as Pasture (Scene de pâturage), 1912.

Brown, Milton, The Story of the Armory Show (New York: Abbeville Press, 1988), p. 289 (no. 247), as Scene de pâturage. Chicago, 116. Pasturage. Now called Pasture, 1912.
exhibition_history:
Association of American Painters and Sculptors (organizer), International Exhibition of Modern Art; traveled to New York, Armory of the 69th Infantry, February 17–March 15, 1913, n.p. (cat. 247), as Scene de Paturage; Chicago, Art Institute, March 24–April 16, 1913, n.p. (cat. 116), as Pasturage; and Boston, Copley Society Hall, April 28–May 19, 1913. [New York and Chicago only]

Chicago, Art Institute, The Arthur Jerome Eddy Collection of Modern Paintings and Sculpture, December 22, 1931–January 17, 1932, pp. 22 (cat. 14), 25 (ill.), as The Pasture, c. 1912. 

Providence, Rhode Island School of Design, Exhibition of Paintings, Water Colors, Drawings and Prints by A. Dunoyer de Segonzac, March 6–21, 1933, n.p. (cat. 1), as Pasturage. 

Chicago, Renaissance Society, University of Chicago, Catalogue of Paintings of Sea and Land and City Streets, June–August, 1933, cat. 6, no cat. 

Chicago, Arts Club, Retrospective Exhibition by André Dunoyer de Segonzac, November–December 1938, cat. 6.

Cincinnati, Art Museum, Pictures for Peace, A Retrospective Exhibition Organized from the Armory Show of 1913, March 18–April 16, 1944, n.p. (cat. 30), as The Pasture. 

Flint, Institute of Arts, Masterpieces in the Midwest, May 4–June 4, 1961, n.p. (cat. 43), as Pasutre. 

Amherst, Mass., Mead Arts Building, Amherst College, Armory Show in Retrospect, February 17–March 17, 1958, pp. 17 (cat. 14), 18, as Pasture, c. 1912. 

Utica, N.Y., Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, Armory Show – 50th Anniversary Exhibition, February 17–March 31, 1963, pp. 50 (cat. 247, ill.), 204, 211, as Pasture (Scène de paturage), 1912; New York, Armory of the Sixty-ninth Regiment, April 6–28, 1963.
provenance_text: The artist; Arthur Jerome Eddy (1859–1920), Chicago, Mar. 1, 1913 [Brown 1963]; by descent to his wife Lucy O. Eddy (1863-1931) and son Jerome O. Eddy (1891-1951), Chicago, 1920; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1931.
